title: Top Sharjah locations where rents are cheaper | GulfNews.com
text:
Dubai: Planning to move away from the city centre to save money on rent?  The latest data show that tenants who are open to living farther afield can find even cheaper options in places like Sharjah, where rents have recently dropped.Property analysts have confirmed that, as rents in Dubai's centrally located properties remain out of reach for many low or average-income earners, the suburbs remain a magnet for tenants. Jesse Downs, managing director of Phidar Advisory, however, noted that Dubai tenants are relocating, not only because they are looking for low rents. "It's often driven by value."
Accommodation costs in Sharjah dropped by 2 per cent during the last quarter of 2016 from a year earlier and 23 per cent since peak 2008.
In dirham terms, tenants can now spend Dh2,000 to Dh5,000 less on their annual lease for one-bedroom to two-bedroom flats, and up to Dh7,000 for three-bedroom units.
Gulf News crunched the numbers supplied by a real estate consultancy firm to find out which specific locations are actually offering tenants the biggest savings. 
Small apartments 
For one-bedroom flats, a clear winner in terms of rate reductions are the apartments in Al Nahda area, where residential units are going for Dh38,000 a year on average, down by 9.5 per cent from Dh42,000 in 2015.
Al Qasimiyah properties posted a 6 per cent drop, from Dh33,000 to Dh31,000 a year, offering tenants an annual savings of Dh2,000.
Not far behind is the Corniche area, where tenants can spend Dh4,000 less on one-bedroom flats, which can be had for Dh44,000 a year, down by 8.3 per cent from Dh48,000 in 2015.
The Al Wahda neighbourhood is a great option for savers as well, with landlords of  one-bedroom units slashing prices by 5.1 per cent on average, from Dh37,000 to Dh39,000, yielding an annual saving of Dh2,000.
Also offering a Dh2,000 decline in annual rent are the residential properties in Al Majaz, with annual costs dropping by 4.87 per cent, from Dh41,000 in 2015 to Dh39,000 in 2016.
Two-bedroom flats 
Bigger families looking to rent a two-bedroom apartment can find the most significant rate cuts, about 10 per cent, in Al Wahda, with flats being offered for Dh45,000, compared to Dh50,000 in 2015.
Significant price drops can also be found for similar units in Corniche, with rates dropping 8.3 per cent to Dh55,000 compared to Dh60,000 in 2015.
Al Nahda area prices are also competitive for tenants eyeing two-bedroom units, which are now going for 7.27 per cent less, from Dh55,000 in 2015 to Dh51,000 in December.
In Al Majaz,  similar units have posted a 5.1 per cent decline in rental rates, from D58,000 to Dh55,000, offering tenants a chance to save Dh3,000 yearly.
If two-bedroom units are not enough, there are still savings to be had from larger living spaces in Sharjah. 
The biggest price drop has been posted by apartments in Al Majaz and Al Mamzar, both offering Dh7,000 less.  Three-bedroom units in Al Majaz have dropped from Dh73,000 to Dh66,000 annually, while those in Al Mamzar, lease rates for similar properties dropped from Dh80,000 to Dh73,000 a year.
